intro: Memecylon travancorense, commonly known as the Travancore memecylon, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by winged fruits, typical of the genus Memecylon. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
